definition: without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to sleep/to hibernate
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Xiu
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: I had been working round the clock for days.
sentences.chinese: 我那時已經不眠不休地工作好幾天了。

sentences.english: If you keep burning the candle at both ends with work and study, you'll fall sick sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 你要是繼續這樣不眠不休地工作和讀書，遲早會病倒。

sentences.english: Don't abuse your health by working when you ought to be sleeping or resting.
sentences.chinese: 別濫用你的健康而不眠不休地工作。
這個玩家正在變得不眠不休。

sentences.english: They've worked their fingers to the bone preparing for the big push overseas.
sentences.chinese: 他們可是不眠不休地爲打進海外市場而努力。

sentences.english: There was no noise, except the sound of the restless sea.
sentences.chinese: 除了不眠不休的大海，沒有任何聲音。

sentences.english: The doctors worked around the clock to stem the epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 醫生們不眠不休地爲遏止傳染病而工作。

definition: day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
day and night/round-the-clock
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to be sleepless all night
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
the whole night/all through the night
to stay up through the night (idiom)
day and night/around the clock
the whole night
to work against the clock/to hurry with work to get it done in time
all night/throughout the night
day and night/period of 24 hours/continuously, without stop
to make nothing of hardships
to close one's eyes/to get to sleep
